alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Slow moving showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Anson, southwestern Montgomery, northwestern Richmond and southeastern Stanly Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 710 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow moving showers and thunderstorms 7 miles northeast of Ansonville, or 14 miles southwest of Troy. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rain and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ansonville, Norwood, Mount Gilead, Uwharrie Haven, Covington, Pekin and Lake Tillery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
